result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin N. Taylor in court, in custody with attorney James B. Duquette.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Kevin N. Taylor in court, in custody with attorney James B. Duquette.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Atty Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Kevin N. Taylor, in custody. appears by VIDEO from Dodge Correctional, with Atty James B. Duquette.  
Matter is scheduled on the Final Pre-trial Calendar for today with a Jury Trial set to begin next week Monday.   
Parties advise they have a plea agreement.  The State will be filing an Amended Information in file 2013CF000212 which will include a count of Reckless Injury.  The Deft will plead to that charge and the remaining charges in files 2013CF000212 and 2015CF000397 will be dismissed and read-in.  The State will cap its sentencing recommendation at 5 years initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision.  Discussion between Court and Attorneys as to whether a PSI is being requested by the parties as part of the agreement.  Judge Reddy will require a PSI be prepared.  This case will be added to the 1:15 Call on Friday and defendant will be produced from Dodge Correctional via Writ.  Further proceedings on May 13, 2015 at 1:15 pm before Judge David Reddy.

Final pre-trial at 05-11-2016 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-16-2016 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Kevin N. Taylor in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin N. Taylor in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 13CF212 & 15GF928
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH ALL CHIPS ORDERS
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM AKBIR KANG OR THE BUSINESS AT 176 W. MAIN ST, WHITEWATER, WI. NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM dob 7-29-2011. NO CONTACT WITH THE GRANDMOTHER OF THE VICTIM. NO CONTACT WITH MINOR CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 16.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH PHILLIP HAMILTON.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

15-4081 & 15-4082
Defendant Kevin N Taylor present in court, in custody. Atty Travis Schwantes appeared on behalf of James Duquette. Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
